intro: Alibrexia revoluta, commonly known as the curled alibrexia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally twisted leaves that give it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom during the wet season. Alibrexia revoluta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
